fields.description:
When configuring Issue Navigator to exclude the 'Issue Type' column, after searching for issues and export the result to Excel file, the issue links are absent, whereby the issue keys are not hyperlinked. See below screenshot:
!scshot1.png!

The bug is producable only in JIRA 4.2 and 4.2.1, but the same problem doesn't occur in JIRA 4.0, 4.1, and furthermore, it is not producable in JIRA 4.2.2.
fields.summary: Issue keys are not hyperlinked when exporting to Excel

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Edit Time Tracking at Administration 
#* Time format: hours
#* Default unit: hour
# Browse to an issue and edit the Remaining Estimate or log work first before editing Remaining or Original Estimate 
# Go to system dashboard to view the Activity Stream

*Results:*
admin changed the Remaining Estimate to '18000' on TST-2 (asdfa)

*Expected:*
admin changed the Remaining Estimate to '5h' on TST-2 (asdfa)
fields.summary: Activity Stream does not use the default time unit for Original and Remaining Estimate

Navigate using the arrows on the right to the next issue
Go to another activity tab
Navigate using the arrows on the right to the next issue
The navigation to the right has disappeared...
fields.summary: Search is lost when going to another activitiy tab whilst browsing an item (google chrome)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Created vs Resolved Issues Report week number wrong on edge of year

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issues at dates: Dec 21, Dec 29, Dec 30, Jan 1, Jan 2, Jan 8 
# Create _'Recently Created Chart'_ at JIRA dashboard
# Check chart data

h3. Expected Results
Issues created at Dec 29, Dec 30 belongs to Week52/53 (last week of the year) 

h3. Actual Results
Issues created at Dec 29, Dec 30 belongs to Week1 (first week of the year) 
See screenshot:
 !PS_chart_created.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Created vs Resolved Issues Report in JIRA is displayed week 1 on the 1st JAN 2011 but do not have week 53 from 27th DEC 2010 till 31st DEC 2010. It should be week 1 from 3rd JAN 2011 till 7th JAN 2011

Same problem for 2015/2016: "Recently Created Chart" in JIRA is displaying week 1 for issues created before the 1st JAN 2016  2010. 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Created vs Resolved Issues Report week number wrong on edge of year

I create one Group Picker Fiekd, its name is CC to Group. But is isn't be displayed in Issue Screen normally, and the members of this Group can't receive mail when I create issue. Please look at attachment,its color is abnormal. 
Note: It is normal if put my account to JIRA System Administrators in Global Permissions of JIRA, but it not possible to do like this for ever, because I am only one common user. I think the reason is the permission issue, but I don't know how to adjust it, please help me. Thanks awfully very much.

fields.description:
Hello Guys,

Just stumbled in this one.

If you try to import a single project (through the Project Import function), and in your instance there is a project with a different key, but with the same name as the project you are trying to import, there's no warning until the process actually starts. It fails, throwing a NullPointerException with no clue about what has happened.

Cheers

Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Cannot import projects with the same name
Cannot render image with '&' in the name using !image.png! tag

fields.description:
One problem that I can't find a solution for is e-mail notifications.
E-mail are stored in a Queue before sending.

So when you have a lot of changes for one issue that go like this:
1. Start (first)
2. Comment (second)
3. Resolve (last)

(It sometimes happens within one minute, which is minimum delay for Mail Queue)

I will get e-mail in order: Resolve (first), Comment (second), Start (last)
In that case on top of my e-mail will be the "Start" notification. This can be confusing, as order of e-mail is reverse...

E-mail should be sent in "First In First Out" order, not "Last In First Out".
fields.summary: Order of E-mail notifications (sent from queue)

fields.description:
On CAC the [4.0 upgrade notes|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.0+Upgrade+Guide#JIRA4.0UpgradeGuide-JavaVersion] mention some java 1.6 issues which do not appear on the [Known Java issues|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Known+Java+Issues] page.

I looks like the latter page is quite old as it still mentions JDK 1.4.
fields.summary: Documentation on 'Known Java Issues' is not up to date

fields.description:
I am writing to request that the current Banner Announcement feature of JIRA be enhanced to allow for scheduling of future announcements.

A typical business scenario is:

- JIRA is used to support client support requests
- Company has a holiday
- Company wants to put a banner announcement on the application during the company holiday, that no issues will be responded too

The scheduler should have mechanisms, and operate in the same fashion, as other scheduled services within JIRA (example: source code repository polling).
fields.summary: Banner Message Scheduling
Custom Field Values can't be updated through Remote Calls

fields.description:
I'm trying to find a way to use a single workflow for feature requesting for my customers.
For them it should look like this:
Open request -> Accept request by Support team -> Resolved
On the other hand, for the same workflow, the support team should have extra stages like so:
Open request -> Accept request by Support team -> Accept request by R&D team -> Accept new feature by Q&A team -> Resolved

The point is that the customers shouldn't be aware of inner steps changing (in status field they should always see the status "Accept request by Support team")
I would like to achieve that within the same project without duplicating the project.

Thanks

fields.description:
We are missing an option to automatically assign new issues to certain project members depending on the issue type that was chosen.

Currently you have 3 options:
- all new issues are assigned to the project leader
- new issues are assigned to the component leader (if a component was chosen)
- new issues remain unassigned

We currently have two "project leaders" per project, one for Test Management(Bugs,..), one for Requirements Engineering(New Feature, Improvement,..).
I don't see another option right now than to choose one of them as project leader that has to assigne all issues not belonging to him to the other one.

It would be great to be able to choose more than one project leader and assinging each of them one or more issue types that will be auto-assigned to them
when a new issue of the assigned issue type is created.
fields.summary: New issues to be assigned depending on issue type created

fields.description:
These are the steps I used to produce this problem:

# {{Administration}} > {{Global Settings}} > {{Workflows}}
# Create a copy of the _jira_ workflow.
# Click on *Steps* link for the copied _jira_ workflow.
# Choose the _Resolve Issue_ transition.
# *Add* a new post function.
# Choose _Update Issue Field_.
# Choose _Remaining Estimate_ for *Issue Field* and enter a value of _1h_ for *Field Value*.
# {{Administration}} > {{Schemes}} > {{Workflow Schemes}}
# Add a new workflow scheme.
# *Assign a workflow* and select the workflow created from steps 2 to 7. Assign this workflow to _All Unassigned Issue Types_.
# {{Administration}} > {{Projects}} > {{*View* on any project}}
# Set the workflow scheme created from steps 9 to 10 for this project.
# Create a new issue for this project.
# In the _*Create Issue*_ screen, set the *Original Estimate* to _1d_.
# *Resolve Issue*
# *History* tab under *Activity* section.
# Value of _Original Estimate_ and _Remaining Estimate_ shows 1 hour [3600].

!Issue Before Resolving For Post-Function Remaining Estimate 1h.png|thumbnail! !Issue After Resolving For Post-Function Remaining Estimate 1h.png|thumbnail!

If the *Remaining Estimate* value was set to _0h_ in step 7, the *Original Estimate* is also set to _0h_ when resolving. Also, the *Time Tracking* legend goes missing.

!Issue Before Resolving For Post-Function Remaining Estimate 0h.png|thumbnail! !Issue After Resolving For Post-Function Remaining Estimate 0h.png|thumbnail!

Although this has been fixed in *4.2.1*, this issue needs to be addressed as many users are still on version *4.2*.
fields.summary: Post Function "Remaining Estimate" Sets "Original Estimate" to the Same Value and Time Tracking Legend Missing from View Issue Screen

# Create a ticket
# attach a file. For example, "test.txt"
# add a comment [^test.txt] to the issue.
# attach another file also called "test.txt"
# download the attachment by clicking on the link in the comment. The older file will be downloaded.
  
In JIRA 4.1.2, 
# Create a ticket

# attach another file also called "test.txt"
# download the attachment by clicking on the link in the comment. The latest file will be downloaded.


For more details, refer to the screenshots attached.

The JQL created for a click-through from a pie chart slice seems incorrect.

   2. Create filter (*MyPieChartFilter*) on the custom field (e.g. *MyCustomField* = *SomeValue*).
   3. Add Pie Chart gadget to a dashboard and select *MyPieChartFilter*.
   4. Display Pie Chart and then click on a delicious slice of the pie.
   5. Set statistic type to *MyCustomField*.
   6. Observe that no issues are selected because the JQL incorrectly contains Labels=*PieChartSliceValue*.

When Restoring Backup, "Choose Index/Attachment Path" Query may not Get to Client because of Proxy Timeout

fields.description:
When users upgrade JIRA to 4.2 or later version with XML backup and used a custom directory for attachment path before, as a part of upgrading process JIRA will ask user to choose between using this custom directory or the default directory for attachment path location. Normally, it is no problem. However, we observed the scenario that if user has a big JIRA instance, they may run into a trouble when importing XML backup through proxy. The story is that since XML file is big, parsing XML may spend quite a while, and because getting attachment path depends on XML parse, when the "choose path" query is sent out the client web connection may have been cut off by proxy timeout, then "choose path" query will never be able to send to client side, and it makes restore get to a dead end.

So, I would suggest to add the notice in the below JIRA Upgrading & Backup Restoring doc to recommend users to avoid passing through proxy when making a XML restore, especially when getting a big JIRA instance.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Restoring+Data
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Upgrade & Backup Restore Doc for a Notice to Avoid Passing Proxy

fields.description:
There's two projects: Project A and Project B. Each project has a POP server and a Create Or Comment Handler Service configured. If a user send an email message to comment an issue to Project A Service and in the subject there's a Project B issue key, a comment is created in the Project B issue. 

The service should comment issues considering the project set. I tried to set the catchemail parameter in the service and it did not work. I've checked to comment handlers services and any of them are considering the project to comment issues. I believe this is not a bug, the service should be adjusted to work properly when pop servers and services are configured separately.
fields.summary: Comment Handler doesn't respect especified Project in Create Or Comment Handler

fields.description:
When you try to compare fields values using JQL jira says the value is incorret, meaning that we CAN'T compare fields with dynamic values, example:

project = MY_CUSTOM_PROJECT AND (LastSyncDate is EMPTY or LastSyncDate < updated)  ORDER BY status DESC, key DESC

This filter should bring all issues that are out-of-sync but jira says:

Date value 'updated' for field 'LastSyncDate' is invalid. Valid formats include: 'yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm', 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm', 'yyyy/MM/dd', 'yyyy-MM-dd', or a period format e.g. '-5d', '4w 2d'.

How can I accomplish that? It should work because static values aren't enough.

fields.description:
It seems that when a user clicks on a transition which brings up a transition window with a field which has enough items to make it scrollable, the interaction with this field can sometimes affect the background window as well. I was able to reproduce this on FireFox, Safari, and Chrome on the Mac OS.

I have attached a JIRA 4.2.1 XML backup to this ticket to simplify the repro steps:

- import the XML
- login with username rick, password jira
- view issue AUDIO-10
- scroll all the way down to the bottom on the main page so that the ticket details are no longer showing in the screen and only the comments appear
- click Resolve Issue
- click Fix Version and select something from the top of the list (ie 1, 1.1, 1.2)

As soon as the Fix Version is clicked upon, you should notice that the background screen scroll up a bit even though it should be inactive at this point. This is frustrating for users who are viewing comments at the bottom of the page who are automatically scrolled to the top once they go through a transition.
fields.summary: Scrolling in the transition window seems to scroll in the background window in some occasions

fields.description:
It would be great if there was an event fired when custom fields are added.

So much code that I have written is constantly checking the custom field configurations and field layouts despite the fact that these only change at most once every 24 hours or so. 

It would be much cleaner if I could cache these queries that I making all the time of the custom field configuration.

What prevents me from doing it is that there isn't really a system wide notification of when custom fields or layouts change.  I suppose I could hack DefaultCustomFieldManager, but I've grown tired and had my knuckles so bloodied by hacking into things, that instead I write this request.

Really I think what would be even more grand is if there were a long long list of events that were fired throughout Jira and then thing like caches would subscribe to them like when developing Java GUI's.
Right now almost all the Jira code base is very process driven.
fields.summary: Fire events for things like adding a custom field, field configuration layout changes, etc.

fields.description:
This really affects the Notification component, but I didn't see it in the list, so I chose the closest one.

Currently JIRA has a global notification scheme that only admins can change. However each user may want his/her own notification scheme. Here's a real world example.

A Project Manager may want notifications when assignee make time estimate/worked entries, but some developers may not want this, but then again some developers may. Bugzilla provided this capability so why not Jira. One way to do it is to show the Notification Scheme interface to ALL users.
fields.summary: Request support for per-user notification scheme

fields.description:
Once upon a time we tried to make filename encoding for attachments more robust. JRA-17805 was where that was tracked. (Pete did some stealth work on it, despite not appearing anyone on the issue he did the work; look at the source tab). After looking at a support case today and doing more investigating of the insanity that is [the Unicode spec|http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.0.0/] I think that the current implementation is insufficiently robust.

Right now we do something like:

{code}
File[] files = File.listFiles()
new FileInputStream(files[0])
{code}

It might seem surprising but this can still throw a FileNotFoundException. What can happen is this:

# Use linux.
# Set the user's encoding to ISO-8859-1.
# Create the file with ä.txt. This will be saved on disk as a sequence-of-bytes that includes the byte 228, since that's what a-umlaut is in ISO-8859-1.
# Switch encoding to UTF-8.
# Run above snippet.
# listFiles will see that 228 and try to represent it as UTF-8. It's not valid UTF-8 (characters above 130-whatever can only appear after the surrogate pair marker thing). So it gets replaced with EF BF BD (the Unicode replacement character). So your list will contain the file <EF><BF><BD>.txt, which usually just gets displayed as ?.txt
# When you try to open the file <EF><BF><BD>.txt the filesystem will naturally complain that no such file exists because there *is* nothing with those sequence of bytes as its name.

I think the only way to be safe is to remove all "unsafe" characters from the attachment name. There are two possible options here:

# Leave ASCII characters as-is and replace the non-ASCII stuff with some kind of escaping mechanism. Instead of "Trîcky Nåme.txt" it might be stored on disk as "Tr_cky N_me.txt" or similar. That seems like a decent compromise for most European languages -- they still have some semblance of the original name available. But it screws over the rest of the world. 天才。txt would just become __.txt, which is pretty useless. So I recommend we just do....
# Drop all pretense of keeping the original filename around. Just use the plain ID. Digits 0-9. Never have to worry about encoding issues again(?) The downside: people who want to access the filesystem and browse attachments that way now need to go to the database to decode files. I don't think that is nearly a common enough use case to worry about.

Note that there are also possibly some [Unicode normalization issues|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3610013/file-listfiles-mangles-unicode-names-with-jdk-6-unicode-normalization-issues] that we are currently open to but I still haven't investigated them enough to say for certain their impact on JIRA.
fields.summary: Attachment encoding protection still insufficient
Prototype Feedback - JIRA project configuration interface

fields.description:
IE7 suffers from major memory leaks. Despite [attempting to fix it|http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb250448%28v=vs.85%29.aspx], Microsoft has [repeatedly|http://blog.j15r.com/2007/09/ies-memory-leak-fix-greatly-exaggerated.html] [failed|http://javascript.crockford.com/memory/leak.html].

If we're going to support IE7 then all Javascript development needs to go through the [IE Javascript leak detector|http://blogs.msdn.com/b/gpde/archive/2009/08/03/javascript-memory-leak-detector-v2.aspx] (only needed for versions prior to IE8). I don't know if we want that to be per-checkin, per-DOT, during some kind of regularly scheduled blitz test or what.

Right now we suffer from a [known "problem" in jQuery|http://bugs.jquery.com/ticket/6421] that they don't seem interested in fixing. We will probably need to fork jQuery (and possibly any other external Javascript we use) to fix the problem.
fields.summary: Javascript memory leaks in IE7 via jQuery

fields.description:
The results returned by the Created vs. Resolved report/gadget in v.4.2.1 are different than those reutrned in 4.0.1.
Formerly, the results were cumulative for Resolved. They showed when issues were resolved over time. Now it shows only the issues currently marked as resolved at the time the report was run.  Those which are "past" the Resolved status and are now Closed are not considered/represented. This makes the "resolved" portion of the graph useless.

Worse, it breaks a graph we have worked into our management reporting chain and throws suspicion on our Jira upgrade decision.

See the two attachments, run before and after upgrade from jira v.4.0.1 to v.4.2.1
Data table show 0 in Resolved column up until this week (one week after our upgrade).

Could this state change date from Resolved to Closed have been lost during data import?

Settings on report/gadget wizard:
Project or Saved Filter: [single project selected]
Period: Weekly
Days Previously: 90
Cumulative Totals: Yes
Display the Trend of Unresolved: Yes
Display Versions: Only Major
Refresh Interval: never
fields.summary: Created vs. Resolved Doesn't show when became Resolved over time

fields.description:
The case of the extension of an attachment should not matter when Jira detects what it is (i.e. image).  For example, see attachments in this bug:

bobo.jpg
bobo2.JPG
bobo3.jPG

Only bobo.jpg will be detected as an image.
fields.summary: Attachment Extension - upper/lowercase shouldn't matter

fields.description:
(i) I know, this might be the wrong project but can't find one for Eclipse IDE Connector.

BTT: It's currently not possible, to add a "private" attachment via Mylin / Atlassian Jira IDE Connector in Eclipse.
As long it is not really necessary for normal attachments, we can upload them via Web-Service and set the permissions ("my staff").

BUT

On issues, customers are involved and we use the quite cool Eclipse integration with the Mylin "Attach context..." feature, there is no way to set the permissions correctly. So any time a developer is updating / attaching these informations, the customer will get an E-Mail and might see this (for him) irrelevant zip file..

I don't know if this is a mylin restriction or if it is possible to you to "fix" this...

With kind regards,
~Marcel
fields.summary: Eclipse Plugin - Attach context / attachments with permissions

fields.description:
It would be a great improvement to have the possibility to add automated, scheduled transitions in the workflow system.

As long http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Scheduling+an+Issue and automated E-Mails for filter results causes user to interact and setting the issue to a now state, an automated transition might be used to implement a state like "bug me again in 2 days" and is then set to a "scheduled" state in the meantime.

Therefore, the feature has to define a new target state if there are different transitions possible from within the current state.


Can't find any plugins or hints so solve this in the meantime.

With kind regards,
~Marcel
fields.summary: Scheduled Transitions

fields.description:
the comments posted by Hudson's JIRA plugin contain a '#' character on the first line, used to indicate which Hudson build was used. So it's not the start of a JIRA issue and this seems to confuse the system that parses issues in comments, see attachment: if the rest of the comment does contain JIRA issue ids, the first one does not get parsed (does not get blue font nor blue line in case of resolved issues).
Example comment text showing the problem:
======snip======
Integrated in hudson project #1 ([See http://myhudson/project/1])
#TNSPL-10
#TNSPL-10
======snap======
The first occurrence of #MYISSUE-10 does not get parsed, the second one does.
fields.summary: problem in parsing comments posted by Hudson's JIRA plugin due to '#' character

fields.description:
in any given ticket, using IE8. the user... 

* chooses "Attach Screenshot" and the window "pops up"
* clicks "paste" to add the image
* click "Attach" button

The Attach Screenshot window closes

The user is then presented with an error screen back in their main browser window.
_Depending on what they have loaded into their IE8 browser, they may see a 404 error or a fancier version if they have different error display settings or a google gadget active._ (see attached screenshot)


The work around is to refresh the page.  They then go back to their jira issue and see that the screen shot *did* get attached.  


At this time, we have 3 users reporting this issue as a consistent problem.
fields.summary: IE8- After user clicks "Attach" in the Attach Screenshot window, they are given an error, but the image DOES get added to jira issue

As you may already now, tcServer is a Tomcat server with additional features for monitoring and control tools.
Not surprisingly, JIRA is working fine with tcServer (it's a Tomcat 6.0.20). 

We would like that you officially support this application server.

The MakeRequest Servlet doesn't seem to implement any timeouts when making requests, so if other applications are slow or unresponsive it can tie up Tomcat worker threads for up to 4 minutes, which means JIRA availability is tightly coupled to that of other apps that serve up gadget data

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-1316
fields.summary: Gadget MakeRequest servlet should implement a timeout to avoid hogging requests indefinitely

Need to flag projects status,currently the projects didn't have status.

If we want to close all the task starting with "INTUITIVE_***" assigned to a user (the project has been already closed),it's impossible for us to close the tasks in batch,We were wondering if it's possible to flag the project status,in that case when a project was flagged as 'close',all its tasks will be considered as 'invalid' automatically,then we don't need to deal with the 'invalid' tasks.
